recipes.glusterfs::server_handle_tag_updates: Remote recipe intended to be called by glusterfs::server_{create,join}_cluster
recipes.glusterfs::server_create_cluster: Finds other servers tagged as 'spare=true' and initializes the GlusterFS volume
recipes.glusterfs::server_set_tags: Adds 'glusterfs_server:*' tags so other servers can find us
recipes.glusterfs::server_join_cluster: Finds an existing/joined GlusterFS server and request to be attached to the cluster
recipes.glusterfs::server_decommission: Removes bricks from the volume, detaches from the cluster and resets some tags
recipes.glusterfs::server_handle_live_migration: Remote recipe intended to be called by glusterfs::server_live_migrate
recipes.glusterfs::server_handle_probe_request: Remote recipe intended to be called by glusterfs::server_{create,join}_cluster
recipes.glusterfs::server_handle_detach_request: Remote recipe intended to be called by glusterfs::server_decommission
recipes.glusterfs::server_live_migrate: Live migrate a brick from one live node to another
recipes.glusterfs::client_mount_volume: Runs mount(8) with `-t glusterfs' option to mount glusterfs

glusterfs/server/replace_brick_forced.description: Force brick replacement for dead node

glusterfs/server/storage_path.description: The directory path to be used as a brick and added to the GlusterFS volume

glusterfs/server/replace_brick.description: Number of the brick to be replaced

glusterfs/volume_name.description: The name of the GlusterFS volume. Servers are tagged with this name and trusted pools are keyed off this name, meaning everyone who shares the same name will become part of the same pool/volume

glusterfs/client/mount_options.description: (Client only) Extra options to be passed to the mount command

glusterfs/server/replica_count.description: The number of bricks to replicate files across for a Replicated volume type

glusterfs/client/mount_point.description: (Client only) The directory path where the GlusterFS volume should be mounted (e.g., /mnt/storage).

glusterfs/server/volume_type.description: The type of GlusterFS volume to create (distributed, replicated, etc)
